required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laser Therapy on Orthodontic Tooth Movement
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Lower Level Laser Therapy on Orthodontic Tooth Movement
clinical_study.source: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de Minas Gerais

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this study will be to evaluate if a Lower Level Laser Therapy (LLLT): (1) enhances the levels of important pro-inflammatory chemokines involved in the bone remodeling process; (2) increases the rate of orthodontic tooth movement (OTM) on human subjects.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of orthodontic tooth movement, with and without low-level laser therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: The quantification of OTM was performed before canine retraction
primary_outcome.description: The canine retraction was measured with a digital dynamometer

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of orthodontic tooth movement, with and without low-level laser therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: The quantification of OTM was performed after 1 month of canine retraction
primary_outcome.description: The canine retraction was measured with a digital dynamometer

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of orthodontic tooth movement, with and without low-level laser therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: The quantification of OTM was performed after 2 months of canine retraction
primary_outcome.description: The canine retraction was measured with a digital dynamometer

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of orthodontic tooth movement, with and without low-level laser therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: The quantification of OTM was performed after 3 months of canine retraction
primary_outcome.description: The canine retraction was measured with a digital dynamometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Chemokine levels in the periodontal tissue after LLLT and orthodontic force
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The chemokine levels were assayed on days 0, 1, 7 and 14 after application of orthodontic force and low-level laser therapy
secondary_outcome.description: The chemokine levels were measured in the periodontal tissue after LLLT and orthodontic force by means of a cytometric bead array (CBA)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy and no orthodontic force
arm_group.description: No orthodontic force. Laser was applied on the first day and the premolars were extracted after 24 hours

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy and application of orthodontic force
arm_group.description: Orthodontic force and Laser were applied on the first day and the premolars were extracted after 24 hours
Orthodontic force was applied and the premolars were extracted after 24 hours, with no laser therapy

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy and orthodontic force
arm_group.description: Orthodontic force and Laser were applied and the orthodontic tooth movement was evaluated

arm_group.arm_group_label: Orthodontic force with no laser therapy
arm_group.description: Orthodontic force was applied and the orthodontic tooth movement was evaluated, with no laser therapy

intervention.description: Low-level laser therapy was applied on premolars that were going to be extracted for treatment plan reasons
intervention.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy and application of orthodontic force
Low-level laser therapy and no orthodontic force
Low-level laser therapy and orthodontic force

intervention.description: Mechanical loading was applied on premolars that were going to be extracted for treatment plan reasons and in canines for tooth movement
intervention.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy and application of orthodontic force
Low-level laser therapy and orthodontic force
Orthodontic force with no laser therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Facial convexity
- Protrusion or biprotrusion of the incisors
- Dental crowding
- Healthy periodontal condition
- Satisfactory oral hygiene
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under medications that may interfere with bone metabolism, such as anti-inflammatory, antibiotics and hormonal supplements in the previous three months
- Skeletal crossbite
- Parafunctional habits
- Occlusal interference

facility.name: Pontifical Catholic University of Minas Gerais

reference.citation: Doshi-Mehta G, Bhad-Patil WA. Efficacy of low-intensity laser therapy in reducing treatment time and orthodontic pain: a clinical investigation. Am J Orthod Dentofacial Orthop. 2012 Mar;141(3):289-297. doi: 10.1016/j.ajodo.2011.09.009.
Alhashimi N, Frithiof L, Brudvik P, Bakhiet M. Chemokines are upregulated during orthodontic tooth movement. J Interferon Cytokine Res. 1999 Sep;19(9):1047-52.

Torri S, Weber JB. Influence of low-level laser therapy on the rate of orthodontic movement: a literature review. Photomed Laser Surg. 2013 Sep;31(9):411-21. doi: 10.1089/pho.2013.3497. Epub 2013 Jul 24. Review.

Genc G, Kocadereli I, Tasar F, Kilinc K, El S, Sarkarati B. Effect of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on orthodontic tooth movement. Lasers Med Sci. 2013 Jan;28(1):41-7. doi: 10.1007/s10103-012-1059-6. Epub 2012 Feb 18.
Kim SJ, Moon SU, Kang SG, Park YG. Effects of low-level laser therapy after Corticision on tooth movement and paradental remodeling. Lasers Surg Med. 2009 Sep;41(7):524-33. doi: 10.1002/lsm.20792.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de Minas Gerais
